title: How will technology transform healthcare by 2035? - Quora

response.answer_text: The technology being developed in labs paints a pretty realistic picture of where we are headed in terms of medical healthcare in 2035. Stem cell replacement, zombie cell removal, reduction of inflammation and scarring, lab growing organs for organ replacement, gene editing, DNA and gene repair therapy, medical nanotechnology, etc. A good deal of future medical tech will be mostly repair based approaches to undo damages and prevent the onset of ARDs (age related diseases) and cure them in the form of periodic intervention. Eventually stuff like nanotech could keep the body sustained without the need for periodic.
